args.natural_language_statement: Let Y be a locally compact Hausdorff space. Prove that any closed injection f : X → Y is a homeomorphism onto its image. In particular, any proper injection f : X → Y is a homeomorphism onto its image. Translate to Lean4 (import Mathlib at top) and end the Lean statement with := by sorry.

This is a less aggressive version of `rw?`. It will attempt to prove the goal with
rewrite search, using the `find?` search algorithm with 2000 search depth, and a
maximum of 5000 rewrite lemmas.
-/
def rw_less_aggressive?

args.content:
import Mathlib

variable {X Y : Type _} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y]
  [LocallyCompactSpace Y] [T2Space Y]

/-- If Y is locally compact Hausdorff, any closed injective continuous map f : X → Y
is a homeomorphism onto its image. -/
theorem closed_injective_is_homeomorphism_of_locally_compact_t2 (f : X → Y)
  (hf_closed : IsClosedMap f) (hf_inj : Injective f) (hf_cont : Continuous f) :
  Homeomorph X (Set.range f) := by sorry

/-- In particular, any proper injective continuous map into a locally compact Hausdorff
space is a homeomorphism onto its image. -/
theorem proper_injective_is_homeomorphism_of_locally_compact_t2 (f : X → Y)
  (hf_proper : IsProperMap f) (hf_inj : Injective f) (hf_cont : Continuous f) :
  Homeomorph X (Set.range f) := by sorry

import Mathlib

variable {X Y : Type _} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y]
  [LocallyCompactSpace Y] [T2Space Y]

/-- If Y is locally compact Hausdorff, any closed injective continuous map f : X → Y
is a homeomorphism onto its image. -/
theorem closed_injective_is_homeomorphism_of_locally_compact_t2 (f : X → Y)
  (hf_closed : IsClosedMap f) (hf_inj : Function.Injective f) (hf_cont : Continuous f) :
  Homeomorph X (Set.range f) := by sorry

/-- In particular, any proper injective continuous map into a locally compact Hausdorff
space is a homeomorphism onto its image. -/
theorem proper_injective_is_homeomorphism_of_locally_compact_t2 (f : X → Y)
  (hf_proper : IsProperMap f) (hf_inj : Function.Injective f) (hf_cont : Continuous f) :
  Homeomorph X (Set.range f) := by sorry

import Mathlib

variable {X Y : Type _} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y]
  [LocallyCompactSpace Y] [T2Space Y]

/-- If Y is locally compact Hausdorff, any closed injective continuous map f : X → Y
is a homeomorphism onto its image. -/
def closed_injective_is_homeomorphism_of_locally_compact_t2 (f : X → Y)
  (hf_closed : IsClosedMap f) (hf_inj : Function.Injective f) (hf_cont : Continuous f) :
  Homeomorph X (Set.range f) := by sorry

/-- In particular, any proper injective continuous map into a locally compact Hausdorff
space is a homeomorphism onto its image. -/
def proper_injective_is_homeomorphism_of_locally_compact_t2 (f : X → Y)
  (hf_proper : IsProperMap f) (hf_inj : Function.Injective f) (hf_cont : Continuous f) :
  Homeomorph X (Set.range f) := by sorry
